    Rating: 5

    2013-05-08: Cannot beat the value, and these batteries last way longer, for only being a slightly higher capacity. It's great to get this, especially since it comes with a charger, so you never run out of power. These batteries also run cooler, too, which keeps the phone much cooler overall, it seems the processor doesn't have to pull from a hot battery, so it keeps it cool too, somehow. Either way, DEFINITELY buy. I use them for my Evo V 4G with virgin mobile, and With a custom ROM, s-off, and rooted. With some tweaks, I even managed to double the battery life, as it sleeps much deeper too.

    Rating: 5

    2011-10-24: You get two batteries and a charger that is universal to charge almost any battery for your phones. My HTC runs out of battery pretty quickly, so these do very well for me. It's good to restart your phone daily. When one battery low, I replace it with a fresh one and I have another 6 hours of phone life. Very convenient for me.

    Rating: 4

    2013-01-16: This is a must have for smart phone users that have removable batteries. What I like about this is that I can charge one set of batteries while using the other. When the other runs down, it's simple to just swap batteries rather than plug in the phone and wait for a recharge.I'm very happy with this purchase.

    Rating: 5

    2012-05-30: After having the batteries and charger for about two months or so then the battery swelled up and melted part of the charger. It is unusable now. I loved having the extra batteries but I think the charger should have lasted longer than two monthsUpdatecustomer service contacted me within a few hours of posting my original review to inform me how rare the problem was, ask me to send pictures and informed me they would send me a replacement. I am waiting on that shipment now and will update later on how everything works out, but I was very impressed with the customer service. Thanks

    Rating: 4

    2012-04-11: The batteries outlast my oem that came with the phone. It is 1900 mAh, which 170 mAh more than the original and trust me it is really noticeably longer life in my Evo 3D. Before I would only get about 10 hours of life on moderate use, now it is about 16-18 hours. You get 2 for an awesome price. If Sanyo Eneloop are the kings of AA/AAA rechargeables (I own A LOT of those, they are that great), these Ankers are right up there. I did try some cheap 1930 mAh for about $10 for 2 and it didn't work out well. I also notice Anker making laptop batteries which also have 4+ stars.The charger is so convenient. I know instructions are bad but you can't mess it up. Place the battery by sliding the white portion down to fit your battery model and align the two pins. It doesn't matter if the battery is backwards, as long as you touch the negative and position terminals to the gold pins it will light up and ready to be charge. It is reverse polarity intelligent. Red indicates charging and blue is done. I notice it takes about 3-4 hours so a little bit longer compared when the battery is being charged inside the phone. Slow charging is good for the battery anyways! Don't remove the charger from the outlet until it is bright blue, there is a brief phase of pink led color (change from red to blue) that may last about 15 minutes. I use it to charge my fiancee's batteries, nintendo gameboy advance, and my SimplyVibe speakers. I only carry this universal charger when we travel. The usb port works great for simultaneous charging with the phone. I rarely use the micro USB port to charge it but it works too.To conclude, I'm very satisfied with Anker batteries and the charger. You can get them on eBay for $18 but those batteries will have 1800 mAh with the charger instead of 1900 mAh.

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-21: It's always good to have two batteries for the smart phone that use battery fast. The charger is nice with many options to connect to the power source. Putting the battery to the the "+" "-" terminal would be tricky at the first time but it's not rocket science to figure it out.

    Rating: 4

    2012-07-03: Using these for my CDMA (Sprint) HTC EVO 3DAs with anything that's cheap and on Amazon, you never know what you're really going to get. Well not only is this a great deal, but it's a superb product! I'm not just, "Meh, it was only $30." I'm more like, "WTH!? These were only $30!" You never realize the handiness of a battery charger as opposed to a phone charger until you've got one! Especially when it comes with TWO batteries! No more being tied down because your phone's gonna die. Just pop in the already charged battery and put your dead on the charger. Voila.These batteries have a little bit higher of capacity (1900mAh vs 1730mAH) so I was expecting them to last a little longer than my OEM battery, but NOT A LOT LONGER! I swear these last alllllll day. Literally a 24 hour period can go by before I have to charge these.I recommend you root your phone so you can recalibrate your battery and phone. It's a lot easier said than done, I know, especially now with HBOOT 1.50, but it can be done. I did it and now I'm noticing even more longevity. Add that with the CPU Tuner app (for rooted phones only) and you're set.Best deal ever. THANK YOU!

    Rating: 5

    2013-02-27: Now I can go the whole day using my phone full throttle without worrying about dead batteries. Haven't noticed difference between this and OEM batteries.

    Rating: 5

    2012-06-03: I replaced my 1 year old oem battery with these and could not be more happy. They work as they supposed to. Very good buy

    Rating: 5

    2012-08-07: My stock battery was getting old so I thought that's why my juice runs down so quickly. Turns out, after doing many drains and charge ups, I max out at 12-14 hours with 2.5 max screen on. This review is written passed the 1.1 month mark or so, so I've had plenty of time to test out different roms/kernel combinations and even revert to cold stock. I keep my data and wifi off for 90 percent of the time since I don't really need it. But its ridiculous how much more the battery is lasting compared to stock. Not even 2 hours different.Just when I thought my ocd of constantly checking the battery level would be gone....At the beginning, I was getting 22 hours max with moderate use 30 hours with no use at all just to test the run down. I don't believe its my phone thats the problem. My sister has the same phone as I do and she also doesn't use her phone as much but the battery runs down quickly.Maybe I have a faulty battery? Because I've checked XDA and other reviews state they have 2 fulls days on light usage!! I can't even get a day of light usage.On the bright side, the external charger is terrific! :]2 star given-----------------------------EditSo after this review that I made about the batteries, LaptopMate, the seller was very helpful and backed their words and sent me 2 new batteries which arrived in the mail very quickly. I can now say that the new batteries that were sent to me is performing outstandingly. I'm easily pushing out 2-3 of light usage, leaving my 4g and sometimes 2g on the whole time. But of course, your mileage will vary. I rooted and changed roms and kernels around to match my usage and I'm getting the results I got and couldn't be happier. Laptop mate did a great job in the customer service and couldn't recommend them or the batteries more. As of this edit, the external charger pins is starting the sink into their boxes...which I hope will not be a problem in the future.5 star given

    Rating: 5

    2011-11-12: Both batteries work great. This battery should have came standard with the phone. Battery charging instructions are vague. Charging is simple , align 1 pin to positive ( +) the other pin to negative ( - ) . Charger recognizes polarity so it doesn't matter what pin is positive. The charger also works on any cell phone battery. I used it to charge a Samsung & blackberry battery.

    Rating: 5

    2013-07-20: I went ahead a shelled out the extra money for this battery kit. But I am so pleased that I did. One of the best choices I made. The batteries have a much longer life and now I have a fully charged backup (the second battery). The charger is great too. I have already charged many different batteries with it. I strongly recommend spending the little extra money and getting the Anker name, the two batteries, and the charger.     2011-11-26: We all know the stock battery that comes with the phone suck. Doesn't even last for more than 6 hours as the receiption at my work place suck. So battery drains quick.     Rating: 5

    2011-10-02: I have a HTC Sensation 4G on t-mobile and my battery was dying way too fast so I decided to upgrade to these Anker batteries.The price was great for 2 batteries and a charger. I was worried I might only be able to charge them using the supplied charger but that's not the case. I can charge these just fine inside my phone with the regular charger that comes with the phone.The battery life on these is roughly 4+ more hours than the factory battery.Probably for 2 main reasons.1) These batteries have more physical capacity than the standard ones that come with the phone.2) These batteries don't get as hot as the standard ones under use. A hot battery drains faster and loses max capacity faster than a cold battery, so that helps these stay alive longer.I bought the 2 pack because I wanted to give one to my friend with the same phone as a gift. She loves the battery as well.Now I keep the standard battery in my backpack as an emergency backup but I never need it.I keep my 4G and WIFI connections ON 24/7 and I do a moderate amount of web browsing, gaming, phone calls and texting on my phone and this battery lasts all day and still has about 30% when I get in bed. EXCELLENT battery.As a bonus, the charger that comes with it is great, it can charge all kinds of cell phone batteries and can be adjusted to fit them. The light turns red when you stick your battery in and starts to transition to purple when it's near complete. Then it turns bright blue when it's done charging and has a built in overcharge prevention system.

    2012-09-26: Virgin Mobile's LG Optimus Elite is an android phone with a lot of features. Besides the standard phone calls and texting, you can take still photos and videos, watch YouTube videos, download books, play games, read your e-mail, surf the internet, use Google maps, check Facebook, listen to music, use a calculator, check the news and weather, and much more. The phone has a 3.5 inch Capactive touch screen, weighs 4.25 ounces, and measures 4 x 5 x 2.47 x 0.39 inches. The 1520 mAh lithium-ion battery is rated for up to 7.2 hours of talk time and up to 10.5 days of standby time.After what turned out to be a disastrous experience with thePCD Venture Prepaid Android Phone (Virgin Mobile), I needed a new cell phone. I've been very happy with the LG Optimus Elite. It does everything well - I've had no problems making phone calls, texting, surfing the Internet, buying apps, taking pictures, watching videos, etc. The sound is nice and crisp and I've had no problems with dropped calls. The keyboard is a bit tiny and I take full advantage of the Voice Import voice recognition software that allows me not only to dictate text messages but surf the Internet, send e-mail, and more. The camera/camcorder takes nice pictures. The GPS is a nice bonus - I use a handheld GPS to do geocaching but it's nice having the GPS on the phone if I decide at the last moment to look for a geocache and I don't have my GPS with me. The phone uses the Sprint 3G network and I've been pleased with how easy it is to use the internet on my phone - no matter where I am. The battery lasts a long time - much longer than other cell phones I've had.The LG Optimus Elite is part of Virgin Mobile's Beyond Talk Plan (meaning I pay a monthly fee rather than topping up every three months) but there is no contract and it is a nice phone and well worth the monthly fee.

    Rating: 4

    2012-06-17: My wife had the Optimus V and constantly complained about running out of space. That phone only has 150mb of user space, this one has about a gig (4 GB total, 1 GB user accessible). One less complaint I will be hearing...I am very impressed with this handset. As others have noted it actually has a 1 Ghz Snapdragon type processor, not the 800 mhz listed, along with 512mb of RAM. It is very fast and smooth in operation. Running Android 2.3.7 helps enormously (a huge upgrade from the Froyo previous Optimus Vs were running). Not worried about whether ICS is coming to it, Gingerbread does the job just fine.The wifi receiver seems very fast, and the GPS (a real GPS, BTW) acquired a lock and fix almost immediately.Screen size is 3.5", which doesn't sound like much of an improvement over the 3.2" of the Optimus V until you put them side by side. The Elite's screen is *much* easier to type on. It's the same size as an Iphone (it actually looks alot like one...)I have been toting around a Droid X for a year and a half yolked to Verizon. I am starting to think that the wife just got me beat...I'd highly recommend this one to anyone looking for a decent Android phone and who is trying to avoid the ridiculous costs of a contract with the big carriers. For $150 up front and between $35 and $55 a month you get the full experience.VM is going to make alot of money off of these, I think.EDIT: One week later, and the OE has lost a star. I had to return the first unit because some malfunction was killing the battery FAST. It would die in less than 6 hours. I have been using Androids for a couple of years and know all the tricks, couldn't get the first one to settle in. Took it back and exchanged it for another one, and after some fiddling I have the battery sipping juice. The replacement unit has been acting a bit quirky too (one random reboot, some strange stuff involving the Wifi reciever and call/messaging lags, which toggling Airplane mode seems to fix fine) but I *think* I have it running fine now... And when it's running fine it's still a 5 star phone for the price.I docked it a star because the first one was a lemon and the second one has been acting funny, but seems tight as of now. I can't give something with that record 5 stars. Still, this is an impressive phone for the price tag. I'd still upgrade to it from the OV, it is just that much better a phone. I would say that with the issues I have had, though, someone with little knowledge of the Android OS or inclination to play around with the settings (like my wife) might have a hard time with this phone. It is finicky, but when calibrated right it runs like a champ.Just be ready to send it back or exchange it, because it seems this initial batch obviously has some defective units floating around. Amazon has a great return policy, so I wouldn't worry about it.EDIT 2: A few weeks later and the OE is running like a champ. It is sipping battery after a couple of changes (Airplane mode resets a couple of times, mostly) and running smooth and fast. Wife is getting home with 40% battery after 12 hrs continuous no charging, not bad for a small, thin phone. Now Otterbox just needs to make a case for it...The wife is very happy with it compared to the OV. VM is finally starting to get some really good phones out there.

    Rating: 4

    2012-09-06: I purchased the phone through amazon on Friday 7/20/12, received it 4 days later and so far so good. I was able to install a 16gb class 10 mini SD card, added about 50 apps, half of which I still currently use most of the time and I still have about 160 to 199M memory left. Whatever apps could be saved on the SD card, I did so to save internal memory. Thinking back, my old phone (also through Virgin Mobile) was a Samsung Intercept and I usually experienced crashes due to lack of internal memory.With my old phone, I deleted as many apps as I could and monkeyed around with it, but it still got bogged down. Enter...LG Optimus Elite! In some ways, it does remind me of my old phone, but the screen is obviously larger. Unlike the Intercept, I find myself using styli more often then not. I also picked up a keyboard that allows me to type in larger blocks of text for notes, etc. It uses blutooth and I have to remember to go through some steps to use that. I had to order bypassing software in order to run it for my phone though a company overseas. Well worth it to me though. Read my other reviews about that story.I found a protector frame (silicone?) for the phone which makes it look more like an I phone. I also have become efficient in removing the outer and inner frame in order to remove the battery, should it become necessary. And to think I also bought that other phone which prevents you from doing so. Speaking of battery, it doesn't last an entire 24 hours even with the GPS turned off, etc. I do keep a few alarms up as well as a weather updater.The surprise with Virgin Mobile for me was that my monthly rate was going up. I guess I should have read all the very fine print provided on the website stating which models or release dates pertained to that change. Turns out, I don't mind so much since I made sure to use only wifi at home and the most minutes I've used are around 200 minutes/month, so I was able to stay with the cheapest plan now offered. I can also watch a movie streaming over 3G or wifi, no problem. THAT, my old phone could never do. Internet searches are now pretty good and I've used it often to compare online prices to store's prices, not to mention, read reviews on amazon.com.All in all, I like this new phone pretty much and I would carry more often, but the added frame makes it a little to heavy to just throw in my pocket. I certainly wouldn't put it in a pocket without a case or protection of some kind. After I have had it a year, I'll update the review. I may not, if the phone is rendered old school like so many have before.6/25/13: 1 year update (11 months actually). First, that silicone hybrid protector has been a phone saver for me. I can't tell you how many times my hubby dropped his HTC EVO V 4G out of his front shirt pocket when leaning forward. Silicone = staying stuck in place. As for the phone, it's on it's last legs. Good thing that I bought it with the amazon card promo. That puts it at almost $8.00 per month for me (would have been $11.80/month at full price).Current problems: 1) The charging port is getting loose, 2) I am now not getting notifications of my calls and texts, for the most part (my first hint that I'm getting a call is when VM notifies me of a voice mail message...I did check my prefs to make sure that calls aren't getting sent to VMail), 3) getting a signal is more difficult than ever, 4) I'm able to get home long before my text gets to my intended party (I send an "I'm on my way" message before I take off...15 minutes later, bing!)but I'm already home. That last one could be Virgin Mobile's doing, not sure how. I'm now looking at Samsung Galaxys, jelly bean.

    Rating: 3

    2011-08-07: I recently got theHTC EVO 3D 4G Android Phone (Sprint), and soon determined I would like a capacitive touch stylus to use with it. While I use my finger much of the time, I don't want to when I'm eating, just put hand lotion on, etc.The amCase (TM) Ultra-sensitive 2-in-1 Capacitive Stylus for Apple iPad, iphone was the second stylus I bought for my Evo 3D. After a disappointing experience with the first stylus I bought, I was hoping for a better experience with a higher priced stylus.I wasn't disappointed in the way the amCase Ultra-sensitive stylus wrote on my capacitive touch screen. The experience was very smooth, very responsive. I have absolutely no complaints regarding the way the stylus works with my Evo 3D.To add even more functionality, the amCase stylus is a regular pen on the other end, making it very useful for moments when you actually have to write on real paper. The pen function writes well, although it isn't the best pen I've every used. That really wasn't quite as important to me as long as it wrote well and gave me the versatility of a combination pen/stylus.It also has a clip on the side that holds the stylus very securely on shirts, purse pocket, etc. I kept it clipped to the POUCH that I bought for my Evo 3D so it was always handy when I wanted it.Where the amCase stylus failed me is in the design. It is comfortable enough to hold and use, but the major flaw in its design lies in the screw mechanism that opens the pen and allows the pen to be refilled. Within a week, this screw came undone and the half with the stylus tip fell off. Of course this couldn't happen in my purse or in my house, but in a store. I didn't notice until I got home and went to put my phone on the charger.I struggled with how to rate this. The stylus and pen work well enough that I can't rate it with one star, although the ease with which the stylus falls apart and is lost is a complete design failure. I can't in good conscience give it more than two stars, and I feel generous in doing that. With an original price point of about $25, this stylus should have a better, more reliable design. As it is, I wouldn't recommend it even at the much lower sale price it is currently sold at.As an alternative, I prefer the styluses below. Neither has a pen function, only a stylus, but they work well, are reasonably priced, and have a much more reliable design.*3M Smart Pen - Grey Clip-On Design - Precision Touch Pen for Mobile Handheld Devices*3 Pack of Universal Touch Screen Stylus Pen (Red + Black + Silver)**UPDATE ADDED 09/10/11**After I posted the review above, I was contacted by AM Express, who said they believed I had received a defective model and asked that I verify my shipping address so they could send a replacement. Within a few days of receiving the replacement, I tucked it in my jeans pocket thinking I'd be using it when I reached my destination but it fell out of my pocket and was lost. I had not used the clip to attach it to my jeans, merely slipped it inside my pocket, so this was not the fault of the design, just bad luck. Unfortunately, I didn't have the second stylus long enough to determine if it was indeed better than the first one I wrote about in my review above.So, I ordered a third amCase stylus. I truly hoped that the first one I received was merely defective and that I would have a better experience with the next one. The third one arrived already broken. I had it shipped to my office, opened it downstairs in the receiving area, and found the problem before I even made it back upstairs to my desk. The end with the silver tip that is attached to the shirt clip was broken and wobbly, making the shirt clip unreliable. When I returned to my desk, I filled out an RMA with Amazon and sent it back the next day for a refund.It was nice of AM Express to send the replacement stylus, although I think their gesture was motivated by their desire to have me replace this review with a positive one and was not necessarily born out of good customer service. I would like to give them the benefit of the doubt, but I've received several emails from them asking that I update my review. So, here it is. I've had three of these styluses and two of them were broken and the third lost within days so I couldn't determine whether it was better or not. Seriously, though, what are the chances that one customer would receive two defective units unless there is a problem with the design or manufacturing of these styluses?

    Rating: 2

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2014-06-17: Love this cable. I use it for my iPad and work just great and the price is worth it. I would recommend for any one with a device with30pins.

    2013-08-29: Made for iOS (iPad/iPod/iPhone) is a very important thing that most people don't seem to realize when buying accessories for their iOS device... Items such as this cable have been rated and evaluated by Apple and a license was paid to Apple for the inclusion in this program showing that the manufacturer gives a little more time and care into their product than your $1.00 dollar-store knock off charging cables.The fit and finish of the cable might as well be OEM, it looks and feels identical to my Apple Retail cables that ship with the actual device granting a piece of mind that you are receiving a quality product.When you pay as much as we do for iOS devices, why skimp on the item you use every day to transfer current to the device.Well worth the money!

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-03: I got so many different cords and they tend to stop working after few weeks , but this one so far so good, no complaints here.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-25: This cable is pretty high quality. I can tell that it's shielded, the connectors are constructed well, and it's made from a decent quality wire. I tested charging with theUSB Power Meterand found that it was capable of delivering 1.81 Amps to the iPad for rapid charging, that is compared to 1.98 Amps with the Apple 3ft cable. 1.81 Amps is consistent with all 6ft cables, even the best, most expensive cables on the market so you won't find better (I've tried.) The .17 Amps less is a small sacrifice for the added length and still well within rapid charging speed for an iPad. For iPhone which only draws 1Amp, there is no loss. You get full power.I have seen some negative reviews and I don't understand why. This is one of the highest quality 3rd party cables I've ever bought, is well constructed, stands up well to daily use, and works perfectly with my Apple devices. Perhaps it wasn't as good and the quality improved by the time I bought it or there were some defective ones. Either way, it's a great cable (and I've bought and tested many.)This is best low price 6ft cable I've found on the market and will be buying more.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-23: I would happily order this cable again and honestly I think I will!Very good buyer I had! Everything was awesome!

    Rating: 5

  • B008Y179IS

    $B008Y179IS

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2012-10-22: Of the few screen protectors I've tried in my day, one other on the S3, so far this is easily the best. For me, application was easy, getting it on the first try. I followed the directions exactly. The trick is to go nice and slow. Don't apply too much pressure on the top until you have it lined up perfectly around the speaker/sensors etc and aligned on the sides, then hold the top of it down with your finger as you peel the rest. Came off nice and smooth, bubbles disappeared with a few swipes of the included card. No problem.Now, as for the look...it's spot on. Other than the border, you can't even tell there's a screen protector on. Seriously I'm amazed. If you use a case which covers the sides (I use the Seido Active, which is awesome btw), like most do, then it's literally nonexistant. The only thing that would give it away is the texture. Now calm down, it's not that bad, no rough or ripply feel, but it seems to catch your finger easier than the screen. You know how occasionally if you're finger was wet and you dried your hands and tried to use your phone, it can be kind of..."sticky?" As in it's tougher to slide than usual, not actually sticky. Well there's some of that, but not every time, just seems to be a bit more sensitive to it. Hardly a deal breaker though.Only other issue is I guess I used too much pressure when getting rid of some bubbles. In the bottom left corner, closer to the home button than I'd like, there are a few tiny, near transparent scratches that I can't get rid of. They are maybe 2 mm long each and are definitely only noticeable if you look...but I can't stop looking. I'm hoping I'll get over it and forget and life will go on. It's really not that bad, but it does keep me from giving a perfect 5 stars.Overall, I HIGHLY recommend this product. It's biggest advantage IMO is the ability to use a case with it. I liked the Tech and Armor Shield and all of those, but apparently they cover the WHOLE screen, meaning if you try to use a case, it'll pull the edges up. I have to use a case, so this is perfect. I feel like I could conquer the world now with my secure S3. It really is amazing how I can't tell it's on there at all. And a final, added bonus, is I also got 4 instead of the advertised 3, as well as an e-mail explaining this is because they understand it can be tricky to apply, so they gave an extra. Very cool.

    Rating: 4

    2012-10-14: I knew the screen protector did not cover the entire face of the phone when I purchased it. I read the explanation from the seller that the space around the protector will typically get covered by cases. My case does not cover the unprotected areas. I would not purchase this product again but I will continue to use it since I've already purchased it. The screen protector is clear and great for viewing. I thought it was a challenge to get on without bubbles. My first attempt resulted in ruining a protector but since 4 came in the box instead of 3, I didn't mind.

    2013-05-28: This works well for my Galaxy s3 and it came with 4 of them. I am on my last one now and I will be ordering another package of them. You can see the scratches it saves your phone. The curve on the outside of the screen is accounted for and it fits perfectly if you measure correctly.

    Rating: 5

    2012-09-25: I've used a number of screen protectors, and this one is by far the best I've seen.INSTRUCTIONS -------For bubble-free application, you'll need a shower/bathroom, blue painter's tape, and the stuff that comes in this package.1) Start up the shower to get the bathroom super steamy. Ideally, just shower and then perform these steps afterwards. The steam removes dust from the air but shouldn't damage your precious phone.2) Clean the screen completely using the microfiber cloth from the package.3) Remove one screen protector from the package and place it on top of the screen as though you're installing it. (DO NOT remove any of the layers yet.)4) Once you've placed it exactly where you want it to go, carefully place a long strip of blue tape along ONE LONG EDGE of the phone, overlapping one edge of the protector. This should create a kind of hinge with the screen protector. Video: [...]5) Lift up the screen protector from the untaped free edge and gently blow over the screen to remove any traces of dust.6) CAREFULLY peel off the bottom layer of the screen protector (the face that will touch the screen). DO NOT touch the exposed sticky surface.7) Starting at one corner, start to lay the protector down, using the squeegee (included) to flatten it. Do this slowly and methodically by creating a slight bend in the protector and using the squeegee to sweep across where the bend touches the screen.8) Once the protector is fully placed, use the squeegee to push any bubbles toward the edge. If you see any dust, you either need to start again or you need to use some scotch tape to remove the dust.9) Remove the blue tape.10) Remove the top layer of the screen protector. DONE!PROS -------* Customer service is great. The seller communicated quickly and even threw in an extra protector!* The protector fits perfectly on my AT&T; Galaxy S3. It covers the screen with a clearance of about 2-3mm of space from the phone edge. This is desirable because it reduces the amount of grit that'll get under the edges.* No bubbles! Follow the instructions above and you'll see this comes out flawless.* The surface is extremely smooth; it's indistinguishable from naked glass. A lot of people complain about traditional protectors because of the tactile feel, but this is smooth and perfect.* Minimal aberration/darkening. The screen is very bright and you can only see a bit of thin-film diffraction in specific lighting (colorful patterns) when the screen is off.* It sticks on but isn't tacky. I bet you can remove and re-stick this multiple times. This also means that dirt doesn't really get trapped under it.CONS -------* Doesn't reduce glare. If you want something that does, go for a protector with a matte finish.* Fingerprint magnet. Get a cleaning cloth.* On mine, some of the edges aren't quite flush. Not a big deal.

    Rating: 5

    2013-02-14: I think that the iSmooth name screen protectors are great! got them for my Galaxy Note 2 as well, and absolutely love them! just do yourself a favor and be sure to apply in a dust free environment! I have 1 or 2 tiny air bubbles due to tiny pieces of dust, but I just decided to leave them after much struggle

    Rating: 4

A few weeks later my sis(who owns this phone) told me the bottom is already peeling off.     2012-12-19: The screen protector has a decent feel and is very clear when clean. Also, the installation goes pretty smoothly if you follow directions and know what you're doing. The screen does not fit the bottom of the screen very well. I have Seidio's hard case on by S3 and the iSmooth leaves 1/8th of an inch of the phone uncovered on the bottom. It's extra awkward because the edge of the protector ends on the back and menu touch buttons on the phone. It would be much better if the protector was a little longer near the bottom. The second issue is that the iSmooth is easily smudged by the oils from your fingers. Once smudged, the protector gives off a rainbow streak and causes the screen to be blurry. Granted, this is not an anti-matte screen, but I've had over non-anti-matte protectors from other brands and they did not smudge so easily.Bottom line, I'm buying another set of protectors from a different brand.

  • B007PPYXMY

    $B007PPYXMY

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2012-09-29: This case doesn't add too much bulk to the device, the kickstand is a little flimsy but I bought this case earlier last year and it is still going strong. Will be purchasing Seidio products in the future.

    Rating: 4

    2013-05-07: When it was brand new, it fit great, very tight. But, after less than 90 days, the bottom was floppy-loose. I carry in my pocket. Tried to get some manufacturers support, nothing. Support is basically non-existent. I had a similar issue with an otterbox case on a past phone and otterbox was all over it. I had a replacement in days at no charge. I should have stayed with otterbox. I will not purchase another seidio active case for my next phone. Spend the money, get the otterbox commuter instead.

    Rating: 2

    2012-05-20: This is the second Seidio case I've had. I had the surface combo for my Incredible, after trying a number of others.Edit 6/15/12 - I've decided I hate the kickstand, and have subtracted two stars for it. It is hard to see from any pictures I've seen just how far it sticks out, nor how much weight it adds (it is made from what seems like pretty stout metal, and has three magnets hold it closed). This phone by itself is slightly wedge shaped, getting thicker at the top. The kickstand sticks out far enough to negate that difference and then some- to the point that the phone doesn't sit flat. The fact that it is metal makes me worry about scratched furniture. It only works in landscape mode, too. But top it off with what appears to be a design flaw in the kickstand packaging, and I am now regretting my purchase. The flaw is that the harder plastic outer cover must flex a bit to fit over the inner soft rubber cover. There is a thin piece of ABS (assumed) glued over where the metal part of the kickstand mounts from the inner surface of the back cover. The glue joint breaks when the outer cover flexes when mounting and removing it from the phone. Mine has come far enough loose that the metal kickstand now just falls out. This is after only a month or so of use. I've emailed Seidio about these concerns, and may seek a warranty replacement.I'd probably subtract another star given these complaints, but I would still recommend the case. Some might find the kickstand less bothersome, and I think it is still a well made case. It is a shame this case isn't sold without the kickstand for this model phone. 99% of the time, I have no use for it.But in the end, my expectations were quite high given my positive experience I had with the Surface Combo on my HTC Incredible. In hind sight, I probably should have gone with that model case again.Original review:When I ordered my Razr Maxx, I knew I wanted another Seidio case, but I was torn between the Active and the Surface. The Surface is essentially a two piece molded ABS case. It is very thin and adds very little thickness or weight, but adds lots of protection. Seidio shows great attention to detail in the molding of their cases so that they fit every curve of your phone perfectly. The Active is a two layer deal with a resilient silicone rubber type inner sleeve and an outer molded ABS exoskeleton which leaves some of the rubber exposed on the sides for grip. It is a very slick design, which is only a little bit thicker than the Surface. It adds only a few grams extra weight, and is WAY less bulky than other two-layer cases, especially the Otter Box Defender. It doesn't have a front screen cover or any port and camera plugs, so it doesn't add water proofing. But it does add impressive protection. I decided to go with the Active because the Razr Maxx is still so thin that a little extra thickness would actually help it sit in the hand better. The Active case also has a kick stand, which is a cool feature, but it protrudes a little. I wish it could be flush, but it hasn't been an issue. The volume and power buttons are covered, but rubber buttons which sit on top of them are molded in, and as a bonus, makes them much easier to find and press. On the phone itself, the buttons are hard to locate by touch.I purchased the holster combo. For me, the holster is one of the best features of Seidio's cases. The belt clip is very stout, and the way the phone is held display-in and fully protected is awesome. The display is actually held a few milometers from the holster back, so nothing is actually touching the display. A spring loaded clip at the top holds the phone very securely and is very easy to operate one-handed. There is no better case where this function is concerned.

    Rating: 3

    2013-07-12: For clarification: I purchased this case in the combo package with the matching holster in the black color. That is why it doesn't show this review as an Amazon verified purchase. I thought it would be best to post my review here as well since this is identical to my purchase but the inclusion of the holster.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~My husband and I both have a Droid Razr Maxx. His was purchased October 2, 2012 and mine was purchased March 21, 2013.We originally purchased twoOtterbox Commuter Case for Motorola Droid RAZR MAXX - Retail Packaging - Blackas I had an Otterbox on my previous phone (a Droid Incredible 2) and loved it. The silicone flaps covering the access ports on the Otterbox Razr Maxx cases were nothing short of a disappointment. They never seated correctly and were always coming loose and flapping around allowing dust and particles into the ports. One of the reasons for purchasing the Otterbox cases was because it had these port covers. Since those failed to perform correctly these cases were removed from our phones and they have been naked and without protection for about a week now.After extensive research of countless cases and reviews here on Amazon, I purchased this case along with three others in a desperate attempt to find the right case for our Droid Razr Maxx phones, once and for all. The cases purchased and compared were:Asmyna MOTXT912MHPCSO006NP Premium Durable Protective Case for Motorola Droid RAZR MAXX XT912 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - BlackTrident Case AG-XT912-BK AEGIS Case for Motorola Droid Razr MAXX (XT912) - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - BlackSeidio BD2-HR3MTRM-BK SURFACE Case and Holster Combo for Motorola Droid RAZR MAXX - Retail Packaging - BlackSeidio BD2-HK3MTRMK-BK ACTIVE Combo with Metal Kickstand for Motorola Droid RAZR MAXX - Retail Packaging - Black~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~First, the Asmyna:Pros:-It is easy to 'install'.-The front and back pieces audibly snap together and seems to hold firm.-It feels good in the hand, being somewhat slick and glossy.-Does not add bulk to an already sizable phone.Cons:-It does not line up properly with the camera, flash, speaker or noise-cancelling speaker on the back of the phone.-It is too slick, causing it to slide off of just about any surface.-It is extremely prone to fingerprints.-All ports are openly exposed to the elements (dust and particle collection, moisture, etc.)Bottom line:I would not recommend this case as, for me, its cons outweigh its pros. I also cannot attest to this product's ability to protect a phone from a drop as I did not feel confident that it would stay on the phone upon any kind of impact. So I chose not to submit my $600 phone to what I deemed an imminent death. This case will be returned.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Next, the Trident Aegis:Pros:-Sturdy, two part design.-Everything lined up beautifully on my Razr Maxx.-Install was a breeze, with only a little encouraging to get the inner silicone liner to set inside the lip of the outer hard shell casing.-The outer hard shell has two built-in mesh-like dust covers that go over the rear speaker and the noise-cancelling speaker when installed on the phone.-The design on the back of the inside silicone liner pokes through the back of the outer hard shell and slightly raises the phone off any surface it is laying on, thus making the speaker sound un-muffled. This is a difficult feature to find in cases these days (why manufacturers don't just place the speaker on the front of the phone for this very reason, is beyond me).-All ports are covered by silicone flaps.-Accessibility to the MicroSD and Sim cards without case removal.-Power and volume buttons are covered and operate as if there was no case on the phone.-When laying face down, the outer rim of the case provides protection to the touch screen by slightly raising it off of any surface it is placed on.-Adds bulk, but not as much as the Otterbox Commuter case.Cons:-There are two locations (along the edge of the MicroSD and Sim card protection flap and along the front, top, center of the phone - directly above 'Motorola') on the silicone liner where the silicone is in extremely thin strips. I do not see these holding up very long as I can see these ripping or tearing after sufficient use.-The protective flaps are flimsy and do not set into place very well (with the exception of the headphone jack cover, which seats almost too well).Bottom line:Even though I have listed more pros than cons, I will not be keeping this case. To me, a cell phone case should be something that you can easily install (and remove if necessary) and not be something that you have to continuously battle to stay in place on your phone. Although it is not a deal breaker for me if a phone has protective flaps over access ports or not - it does matter to me that if a case does have these that they set in place properly and not flap around freely. I also am fearful of the longevity of this case given the thinness of the inner silicone liner. For these reasons, I believe I will be returning this Trident Aegis case.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Next, the Seidio Surface (Case and Holster Combo):Pros:-Lined up well with the camera, flash, speaker, noise-cancelling speaker and all buttons.-Does not add any noticeable bulk.-Exterior surface is has a soft-to-the-touch feeling while remaining hard.-Includes a holster.-MicroSD/Sim card access door area of the case is solid. (This may be a con to others, but I prefer this be solid as I rarely ever need to access my SD or Sim cards.)Cons:-No silicone components making it very slick.-Easy to put on the phone, but be prepared for an all out battle to remove it. I spent close to fifteen minutes fighting this thing, trying to coerce it off of my phone. Due to its lack of any silicone, I could not get a good grip on the case and had to turn my phone off as I kept pressing the power and volume buttons in my all out brawl.-All ports are exposed (except the MicroSD and Sim card access door, see Pros list above).Bottom line:This case is laughable. It is the only case in my many years of cell phone ownership to cause me so much frustration upon trying to remove it from my phone. The scenario I found myself in while trying to remove the case was very similar to trying to get out of a Chinese finger trap - pretty much every movement makes things worse. I prefer a case to fit snugly, as those offer the best protection because they will not slip or slide on the phone. But this Seidio Surface case, wow.. needless to say, despite the pros I listed for it, this case will be returned.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~And, finally, the Seidio Active (Case and Holster Combo):Pros:-Does not add much bulk (as compared to the Otterbox Commuter)-Well thought out and functional two part design-Feels good in the hand-Easy to operate while holding in one hand (not too heavy)-Silicone along the edges makes is very easy to grip and keep your grip. This case will rarely slip from your grasp.-All ports and the camera, speaker, noise-cancelling speaker and buttons line up perfectly.-Power and volume buttons respond with the same (if not better!) sensitivity as if there was no case on the phone.-The MicroSD and Sim card access door is completely blocked (again, I know some others may prefer to have access to this door, but this is a preference of mine as I hardly ever need to remove/replace these cards).-The kickstand is a fun addition - is functional and seems as though it would last quite awhile as long as you were gentle when pulling it from its seated magnetic position.-Includes a belt holster which fits the phone w/case perfectly.-The phone w/case can be seated in the included holster either facing in or out.Cons:-The addition of the kickstand on the back causes the phone to tilt toward the top - this muffles the rear speaker.-With so much silicone exposed on the sides of the phone, I can see the potential for these areas being dust magnets.-The top ports (HDMI, Power and headphone jack) are left openly exposed. Although this is not a deal breaker for me, it may be for others. (NOTE: Because the phone can be inserted into the holster either faced in or out, the holster's clip partially covers the top ports, offering some protection. Not much, but thought I would mention it.)-The retention clip on the holster appears to have a disadvantage because of its design - due to the curve and the distance the clip extends from the phone, I can see this potentially catching on things (seat belts, couches, chairs, etc.) and either breaking the clip entirely, rendering the holster useless and requiring a replacement be purchased OR dislodging the phone from the holster allowing it to fall to the ground.Bottom line:I believe I finally found the case I have been searching for - the Seidio Active. My husband also chose this case of the four we received and I have reviewed here. So, I guess that means I need to purchase another one for myself. The black is exactly what my husband wanted, but I prefer a color that stands out more.. so I suppose I will be buying the red or blue. Once I receive that case, I will update my review to report on the clarity of the color as opposed to the color depicted here online.Thank you for reading. I hope my search helps someone else find the perfect case for them too (as well as saving them the time of conducting the research!).

    Rating: 5

    2012-05-30: I had an OB on my DROID2 and I didn't care for it too much. It just made a bulky phone even bukier.When I ordered my RAZR MAXX, I was looking for something that woulg give me decent protection without all the added bulk.I looked at theDiztronic Matte Back Smoke Flexible TPU Case for Motorola Droid Razr Maxx [ONLY FOR MAXX VERSION] (Verizon & Rogers) [Diztronic Retail Packaging] and this is easily the thinnest base layer of protection out there. Unfortunately, there is not much "cushioning" offered by the TPU case. The TPU case will likely keep the MAXX free from scratches to the body of the phone. The TPU is very grippy - a really nice feel to it.I also tried aTrident Case AMS-XT912-BK Kraken AMS Case for Motorola Droid Razr MAXX (XT912) with Holster Bundle - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Blackand this case was ridiculously HUGE. I would say it easily offers a great deal of protection (even includes a screen protector) but it doubles to triples the weight and thickness of the phone and it it seriously obnoxious looking. While I could just use the silicone portion of the Kraken, it seemed like a waste of money, so I returned it.I finally looked into Seidio and found the ACTIVE case. It seemed like it fit the bill, so I gave it a shot. I like it's "cushioning" ability and the small amount of rigidity given by the ABS plastic "skeleton." However, the big drawback of theSeidio CSK3MTRMK-BK ACTIVE with Metal Kickstand for Motorola Droid RAZR MAXX - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Blackis that, in the hand, it isn't very grippy. I would say it is more slippy than it is grippy.I have pretty big hands & holding the naked RAZR MAXX, it wasn't an issue for me, nor is it an issue with the added dimensions of a small case.I got aTrident AG-R680-RD Aegis Case with Screen Protector Kit for Samsung SCH-R680 - 1 Pack - Retail Packaging - Redfor my Samsung Repp and I love it. More grippy than the Seidio and the skeleton is even more rigid. Thankfully, the Aegis case is nowhere near as bulky as the Kraken. I feel the Aegis offers a higher level of protection without inhibiting any functions. Buttons are more responsive on the Aegis than the ACTIVE.I will keep the active as a backup (plus I love the kickstand) but the overall feel of the Aegis is superior, as is the protection (includes a screen protector). If you decide to give the ACTIVE case a try, Make sure you get a good screen protector too. TheFosmon Crystal Clear Screen Protector Shield for Motorola Droid Razr (XT910) / Droid Razr MAXX (XT912) - 3 Packpairs so well with the ACTIVE case, they seem as if they were made for one another. The Screen Protectors are totally transparent and offer good feel as well.Nothing is as grippy as the TPU case, but the Aegis a really good combination. If it had a kickstand, like the ACTIVE, it would be even better. Oh, well...nothing is perfect!Hope this helps!

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2012-04-20: I'm only on the 3rd charge cycle so the battery isn't fully conditioned yet but it just gave me over 30 hours before it was fully discharged, that's more than twice as long as the standard battery. The instructions that come with the battery are clear about the method of conditioning the battery, I've followed them to the letter. The instructions are to not charge the battery when you receive it but instead to put it in and let the battery drain to 0 and then charge it using the wall charger. For the next four charge cycles you should let the battery drain to 0 before recharging it.The only down side of this battery, and all of the Quasimodo class batteries, is the hump on the back of the GN. Holding the phone is definitely not as comfortable as it was with the standard battery but it's tolerable. My only other complaint is that no one sells a compatible soft skin for hunchbacked GNs. Sendio has a two piece polycarbonate case but I'm not interested in that, I prefer a soft rubbery skin. Hopefully someone will come out with one soon now that there are couple of big batteries available for the GN.

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-07: The battery did not work. It was allegedly brand new.It came without a charge and wouldn't charge up. I cannot recommend it.

    Rating: 1

    2012-04-06: I'm always a bit concerned when ordering one of these extended batteries. I've had one in the past that was so ugly and huge it completely changed the phone. So I was pleasantly surprised when I popped in this new battery and cover. First off, the battery itself is about twice the width of the standard battery. So there is some obvious weight increase. However, not as much as I feared. For a battery that has 300% capacity of the standard and to only be 200% larger, is a nice surprise.The cover is just as surprising. I expected some matte black cover that would not match the rest of the phone. Again I was nicely surprised. It has the same textured look and feel as the previous cover. In addition, it snaps right onto the phone just as the original.So what does this do to the appearance of your phone? Well, it is certainly thicker. I really liked the original thinness but found it to be a bit slick in my hand and had several scary incidents of it nearly slipping out of my hand while trying to use some of the software or buttons. This aspect is now completely gone. The weight is at the bottom of the phone and the extra thickness makes for a nice grip.The most important aspect is the capacity of the battery. I have been following the directions which calls for the battery to be 'conditioned' the first few times it is used. This means allowing it to drain all the way down and then charging it up completely. After a few cycles of charge / discharge, the battery is ready for standard use.My old battery would last only a few hours a day. We have great 4G / LTE in our area so it is always on and draining the battery. I got where I would leave it on the charger at night and all day at work. Still I would see significant draining in the few hours off the charger to less than 50%. With this new battery... wow, I am able to get almost two complete days between charging. This is huge for me as I am a big user of data on this phone and couldn't always be around an outlet. I'm very, very pleased with this purchase. $20 turned my $300 phone into an all-day tool.Pros:o cover matches texture, look, and feel of originalo extra mass makes phone easier to gripo fantastic capacityCons:o does make phone thicker - but that's the only way it can get more capacityOverall - I highly recommend this battery and cover. Makes your investment in your high-tech Samsung phone live up to its potential.

    Rating: 5

    2012-07-05: I've been using the Trexcell Extended 3800mah NFC Compliant Battery and cover since Mar 2012. As everyone using the Samsung Galaxy Nexus Prime knows, the battery life is abysmal; the standard battery was only good for around 4 hours and a lot less if I used it for more than a little texting and talking. I work in the field 10 to 14 hours a day and it's important that I have reliable communication so, I decided to try this battery and it doubled the life of my phones standard battery. I usually get between 6 to 12 hours out of the phone now with normal usage which is at least acceptable.Pros:Doubles the battery capacityCons:Cannot get a protective case that fits the extended batteryMakes the phone thicker if you need to make a fashion statement (doesn't matter to me). Just wish they would make the batteries large enough to last at least 14 hours 3800 to 5000mah. And then have an option for a thinner phone with no battery life for people who are usually near power rather than the other way around.Had a problem with the battery draining in an hour or so, found out that a newly installed app was accessing the GPS and killing the phone so I killed the app. Watch for this, a lot of apps and web sites will access the GPS and kill the battery quickly. Not to mention using the camera will kill it fast as well. The phone companies really aren't thinking when they put so many capabilities into a phone and then place an 1800mah battery as the only power source.Final thoughts; it's worth it buy it!

    2012-06-24: I purchased the Trexcell Samsung Galaxy Nexus 3800mah Extended Battery before buying the Seidio BACY38SSGNLN-BK Innocell 3800mAh, because it was cheaper and I thought there could not be much difference. I was wrong. I followed the "conditioning" procedures so that I would get the maximum battery life. For the first day or so, I THOUGHT I saw an increase in battery life. I was getting really frustrated after a few days, and upon "normal" use, it still had almost no battery at the end of the day. Like one reviewer said, "Not much better than the stock battery."I am not someone who spends a lot of time talking on the phone or web browsing. I am with clients most of the day, so I take and return phone calls, in between clients, have a wi-fi connection (or a data connection if I am not within wi-fi range) for my online scheduling to update in real-time, and sometimes I check my email and/or text messages. I typically start my day at 6 AM and go until 10 PM. When your phone dies at 6 PM, with mild to moderate use, and you still have 4 hours left of your day, that is not good. I realized that it is possible that I had a defective battery and contacted Trexcell customer service. No response. I said "screw it" and bought the more expensive Seidio.MUCH BETTER! I guess you get what you pay for. With the Seidio battery, on my Samsung Galaxy Nexus (VZW phone,) I sometimes can go 2 full days, plus, without plugging it in. There have been a few times I had to actually turn on the data, plus wi-fi and do some serious web browsing just to drain the battery completely, after almost two days of not plugging it in. Of course, if I use GPS, or do an unusual amount of web browsing, I have to plug it in at the end of the day...but it usually still has juice, so I am getting 16-20+ hours on this one. The Trexcell, barely 8-10 hours, on a light day of use.PLUS, what is up with NO RESPONSE regarding the possibly defective battery? I have to assume that isn't defective, but instead just the poorer quality of this battery.

    A great description that explains what this product is all about. Here's what you get!

    2013-07-16: I received a 'for review' unit from the makers or sellers of iFLASH. I did not promise them a good review and they did not ask for one in exchange.This iFLASH may be small but, at 4400 mAh it carries enough juice to fully power up an iPhone 5 (1,440 mAh) at least twice or a Galaxy S III (2,100 mAh) once with some left to spare - keep in mind that the energy transfer is not 100% efficient so don't expect three iPhone 5 charges. Small size and simplicity is what makes this model different and it can be your favorite battery pack for as long as your phone charges through a Micro USB port (or you can supply your own wire) and you supply your own wall charger.It does come with some essential accessories: a charging cable that can be used to both charge your phone and charge it and a nice bluish nylon mesh bag to hold the iFLASH and the USB wire. Besides its ability to charge a phone once you plug it in - and do NOT attempt to use it with anything larger such as a tablet - the only other features include a blue-LEDs charge meter that activates once you press the one white button once and a one-LED flashlight capability that turns itself on or off if you double-tap the white button.I am very found of this model and can't think of any negatives other than the shiny black finish being a fingerprint magnet but I don't know anyone who would spend much time staring at a battery pack. So five stars it is.

    2013-09-25: Power Bank Evaluation - iFlash 4400 Power Bank (Black)This is intended as a cell phone charger - not a tablet charger, since it only charges at 1 AmpmAh - 4400#and Amps of Charging ports - 1 Charging port, only 1 Amp (Instructions state that it is intended for digital communication devices requiring a DC5V input). Please be sure your device will charge using this battery pack.Physical size - Small, fits easily in a pocket, less than 6 ouncesHow is the battery pack charged - Uses included micro charger cable. No charger included, you will need your own or will need to charge this battery pack using your computer.What cords/attachments are included - a single micro charger cable is included. It is used to charge the device and can also be used to charge your cell phone. If you need something other than a micro charger you will need to provide your own cable.What other features/items are included - Flashlight- The flashlight is turned on by clicking the on/off button twice.
